text.0: thou agni god mid mortal men art guard of sacred rites thou art.
text.2: o mighty agni thou must be glorified at our festivals.
text.3: bearing our offerings to the gods.
text.4: o jātavedas agni fight and drive our foes afar from us.
text.6: thou jātavedas seekest not the worship of a hostile man.
text.8: we sages mortals as we are adore the mighty name oof thee.
text.10: sages we call the sage to help mortals we call the god to aid.
text.11: we call on agni with our songs.
text.12: may vatsa draw thy mind away even from thy loftiest dwellingplace.
text.13: agni with song that yearns for thee.
text.14: thou art the same in many a place mid all the people thou art lord.
text.15: in fray and fightt we call on thee.
text.16: when we are seeking strength we call agni to help us in the strife.
text.17: the giver of rich gifts in war.
text.18: ancient adorablie at sacrifices priest from of old meet for our praise thou sittest.
text.19: fill full and satisfy thy body agni and win us happiness by offering worship.
